intro: Castelnavia orthocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf castelnavia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticulturists and botanists.
